_source.title: Lead React Native developer needed - New MVP build for Pet Telehealth Startup - Upwork
_source.content: Who we are: We are Thought&Function (https://thoughtandfunction.com), a London based digital consultancy for startups founded by three entrepreneurial software engineers. We apply design thinking, lean and agile methodologies to help early-stage startups define and deliver their MVPs and iterate to find product/market fit. What the deliverable is: We're working with a new startup in the Pet Telehealth space, contributing to UX and design and owning the build of their backend and frontend application. This project is to work with one of our architects/leads to define and implement the React Native application and CI and release pipeline. The core functionality of the MVP release will contain: - auth (Firebase) - notifications (Emails, Push, and In-App) - content delivery from a developer-friendly CMS (Prismic) - payment (Stripe) - appointments & video conferencing (Leveraging Twilio as the video conferencing solution) The primary and highest priority deliverable is the MVP release, however, we also intend to modularise/componentise as much of the solution as possible to speed up delivery of future projects with similar requirements. Type of freelancer we're looking for: We're looking for an experienced lead React Native developer who will be able to take ownership of the React Native delivery, including the testing and release process to the Play Store and App Store. Must have tech experience: Typescript ReactNative Apollo Client Twilio integration Payment - Stripe / In-App Purchases AppCenter for CI and automated releases Firebase: Auth, Cloud Messaging Nice to have experience: Frontend - ReactJS, NextJS, Styled Components, Styled System, Chakra Your responsibilities: 1. To understand and ensure the goals of the MVP are met 2. To implement and release a high-quality MVP 3. To ensure the React Native implementation is delivered on time and on budget 4. To work with the architect and PM to highlight and minimise risks How the project will be delivered/managed: People: Architect/Technical Product Manager, PM, You Workflow: Kanban using JIRA Phased releases defined with the team An architect/technical product manager from Thought&Function will work part-time (1/5 time) on the project. They will work with you to architect an MVP solution that achieves the MVP goals and is within budget. They will also ensure blockers are removed. The architect/technical product manager will populate the backlog and ensure tickets have enough details, any supporting information and acceptance criteria. They will work with you to estimate the tickets. Regular meetings will be arranged to keep the project on track and running smoothly. Phased releases will be defined by the team, demoed to the client when appropriate. The UX wireframes will be ready but the final UI designs won't be. This project is therefore likely to occur in 2 phases: 1. Setup solution, release pipeline, routing, views, state management, API integration and 3rd party integrations 2. _source.content: A Little About Us... At Rupa Health (www.rupahealth.com), we‚Äôre on a mission to fundamentally improve the health of every person on the planet. We see functional medicine as the missing piece for millions of people suffering from chronic health conditions. That‚Äôs why we are committed to creating the technology for this thriving area of scientifically-backed integrative healthcare. We‚Äôre building the infrastructure for the next generation of medicine. Our first product is the Rupa Labs portal. Rupa Labs makes it super simple for functional medicine practitioners to order, dispense, and receive results from 20+ lab companies in one place. It is essential infrastructure for functional medicine practitioners, turning an archaic 15 hour-a-week process into a delightful 15 min task. With Rupa, practitioners can get back to what‚Äôs important - helping people get well! We‚Äôre backed by and work closely with our world class investors: First Round Capital, Mike Maples / Floodgate, Ron Conway / SV Angel, Joe Montana, Hustle Fund, healthcare domain experts, former founders with successful exits, the product brains behind Gmail, Facebook newsfeed, Dropbox, and more. We‚Äôre also fortunate to be advised by the best in the industry, including the Head of Health and co-founder of IDEO, the co-founder of Honor HomeCare, domain experts with backgrounds from Harvard, Stanford, MIT, Johns Hopkins, and more. We‚Äôve been growing like crazy this year, with exponential month-over-month growth. To help fuel this rapid growth we‚Äôve recently closed a round from First Round Capital, one of the top venture capital firms in the world. A company is only as good as its people, and so we‚Äôre looking for a Head of Marketing who can join us on this fast-paced journey. So, what‚Äôs the role? You‚Äôll be joining the Rupa Health product and engineering team! We‚Äôre a close-knit, scrappy, and hardworking small team, and that means we‚Äôre looking for talented engineers who can offer more than just code. You‚Äôll work closely with the founding team to iterate on the Rupa Labs portal and build delightful new features for our practitioners and patients. There‚Äôs a lot of unexplored territory in this space, and we‚Äôll be relying on your ingenuity and problem-solving skills to come up with novel solutions that can scale. We‚Äôll also be looking for you to provide your thoughts on the product direction and UX design. As an early engineer, you‚Äôll be able to grow as a leader in your role and define the technical direction and vision for the company. You‚Äôll have a lot of autonomy, responsibility, and ownership. You‚Äôll also help define and contribute to the culture of the company as a whole. You‚Äôll be working directly with our technical co-founder who has 10+ years of experience coding, founding startups, and building multiple products in the health / wellness space. What we're looking for - At least 3-5 years of professional software engineering experience creating frontend and backend applications. - Ready and able to jump straight into building in ReactJS and Django. Bonus points if you‚Äôve been a founder! - Ability to move fast and write code with a startup mindset. - Being able to take a broadly defined task and implement it without every aspect being laid out for you. - Security-by-design mindset. Let‚Äôs keep our patients‚Äô data safe. - A passion for functional medicine and creating the infrastructure for the future of healthcare. Current Team You‚Äôll be joining our all-star founding team who have 10+ years experience in the space, have won awards for their biotech research, worked hands on with chronically ill patients, and much more. The founding team comes from Stanford, Wharton, Parsley Health, Lululemon, Everlywell, Coffee Meets Bagel and more. We each have very personal reasons for wanting to transform this space. We‚Äôve experienced firsthand the impact functional medicine can have and are committed to this cause. Beyond our collective excitement for the space, we‚Äôre a super close team who values personal development, being active, growth mindsets, a great sense of humor, and a healthy balance of optimism and realism. We work hard and have a ton of fun. üôå If this sounds like you, we‚Äôre stoked to meet you! _source.title: WebPortal for Network Testing API - Phase 1 - Upwork
_source.content: About Us: We are highly experienced technical people with decades of experience in network management. We are focused on building a network testing system called SEAssure that allows other companies to test their communication networks. We have built an MVP for the SEAssure API already in past few months. What we need: We require assistance in building a WebPortal on top of our SEAssure API to show usage of the system. This would allow our customers to have a UI/UX for using our API without doing any development. We have a backend system called SEAssure that provides the following APIs: - A secure API that is used to request testing of communications network quality. - The SEAssure system returns back the test result via a callback after the test is completed. - SEAssure also has API to create new customers for the API and generate access keys for using the API. - Backend should be able to manage user signups and login as in every generic web portal. All in all there are 6 endpoints in the API at this moment in phase 1. What we need is a BackendForFrontend (BFF) and a FrontEnd itself which means full stack development. The basic requirements of the system are: 1- Users can signup using email/password combination. 2- Users can request a new password in case forgotten. 3- System can generate access keys for the SEAssure API for the user and stores it securely. (We can guide on how to do that). 4- System allows a simple form to create a test and call the SEAssureAPI endpoint. 5- System is able to receive callback and store the result of the test for that user and for that specific test. 6- A reporting page where users can see all the test results in a tabular form. Nothing fancy in this phase. 7- Using SEAssure API to list the networks available for testing. What we provide: We will assist in creating the DBSchema for this backend. We will also provide guidance on secure storage of credentials (API access keys). We have written detailed product specifications with wireframes, personas, API specifications and functional/non-functional requirements. We will provide this document after selecting the developer(s) and would require to sign an NDA. Deliverables: We would need the code to be preferably built with Python + Django. It is important that code is clean and extensible as we expect more development to occur over time. We recommend using a bootstrap or other template for HTML components rather than building your own from scratch. ReactJS is not needed but if the developer thinks it is useful then a case can be made. We would like the code to be deployable in a docker container with external DB connection but during development a simple docker-compose script will be enough with a local DB. We would give access to our project's slack channel as a guest to communicate faster on the project. Budget: $500 Posted On: February 02, 2021 11:15 UTC Category: Full Stack Development Skills:API, Web Application, Django, Python, MariaDB, MySQL, HTML, CSS, Bootstrap Country: Netherlands click to apply
